title: AMBS #1 Revenge of the Black Warrior
How Far Will You Go - Cycle Against Cancer
Sunny King Criterium
description:
The Sunny King Criterium is proud to be a Part of the National Criterium Calendar, Alabama Cycling Association Points Series and
The Lance Armstrong Junior Olympic Road Series.
course: Below is a map of the .7 mile course. The races will follow a counter-clockwise direction. The final straight is a slight uphill.
registration: Registration will open Feb. 4th on BikeReg.com. Day of registration will be available starting 9am inside of Classic on Noble.
notes: All Sunny King Criterium races on April 21, from noon to 9:30pm will STREAM LIVE at www.sunnykingcriterium.com. Five TV cameras around the race course will catch full course racing action, including slow motion replays of finishing sprints and any mishaps on the course. We are excited to partner with velonews.com to bring our races to an even broader global audience. Go to your favorite apps store and download the ustream.tv app if you plan to view the races on your smartphone. Check back for more updates. If you can\'t be there, don\'t forget to WATCH IT LIVE! And don\'t miss the 2nd Annual Foothills Classic RR on Sunday, April 22, in Piedmont
directions:
Noble Street Festival Directions 
Saturday, April 21, 2012
Anniston, Alabama
 
www.mapquest.com
1024 Noble Street - Anniston, AL 36201
printable version



Drive times to Anniston:

Birmingham, AL: 1 hour
Atlanta, GA: 1.5 hours
Chattanooga, TN: 2.5 hours
Spartanburg, SC: 4 hours
Montgomery, AL: 2 hours

From Interstate 20: 
From I-20 Exit #185, travel north on AL Hwy 21 approximately 2.5 miles to Anniston. 
When the grassy, tree-lined median becomes visible continue to 10th street and turn left (west). Park in this area and walk one block west to Noble Street. 
From North of Anniston 
Travel South on Hwy 21. 
A grassy, tree-lined median will become visible. Continue to 10th Street and turn right (west) on 10th. 
Park in one of the lots and walk one block west to Noble Street. 
Printable Directions 
To get printable directions, please visit mapquest.com and enter your starting address, and the following address.

1024 Noble Street
Anniston, AL 26201

title: Foothills Road Race
description: The 2012 Foothills Road Race will be held on Sunday April 22nd in Piedmont Alabama.
course: Course Description: All races will be held on an out and back course. There is one 6.5 mile section of chip and seal pavement starting at mile 9. Please use your carbon wheels with discretion. The finish is flat. Due to road conditions beyond our control, certain parts of last years course, have been taken out. The new courses will be a bit longer with more climbing. View Mens Pro 1/2 Route. and View Womens Pro 1/2/3 and Amateur Route.
registration: Registration: WE WILL NOT HAVE \"DAY OF\" REGISTRATION. PRE-REGISTERED RIDERS CAN PICK UP BIB NUMBER/SIGN WAIVER SUNDAY MORNING BEFORE THE RACE FROM 7:30 A.M. TO 30 MINUTES PRIOR TO THE START OF THEIR RACE. WE PREFER THAT YOU PICK UP ON SATURDAY AT THE SUNNY KING CRITERIUM IN DOWNTOWN ANNISTON IN CLASSIC ON NOBLE RESTAURANT. Registration is only available online at www.bikereg.com. After April 19th registration will only be available on April 21st at the Sunny King Criterium registration table inside Classic on Noble.
notes:
Wheel Trucks: Men Pro 1 2 race will have neutral support provided by SRAM. All other races will be wheel in / wheel out.

Feed Zone: Feed zone will be available for all fields. Feed zone will be located on CR 55 at Pink Burn’s Cabin. Please ask your support staff to use the parking area anot the side of the road. All teams using the feed zone are responsible for cleaning up the area after their riders have passed.
directions:
Directions: For specific directions, we suggest going to mapquest.com and entering the address for the Piedmont Civic Center, which is the Start and Finish of the ride for all route options:

Piedmont Civic Center
500 East McFarland Blvd.
Piedmont, AL 36272

title: Tour de Blue: Cycling for Prostate Cancer Awarenes
description: The Tour de Blue is a bicycle ride that benefits the Urology Health Foundation, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to providing prostate cancer screenings free of charge to men in Alabama who cannot afford the tests. The ride is hosted by the Birmingham Bicycle Company located in the Crestline Park neighborhood of Birmingham.
course: The ride leaves from the Birmingham Bicycle Company at 1105 Dunston Ave., Birmingham, Alabama and meanders through Jefferson, Shelby, and St. Clair counties before returning to the bike shop for lunch. There are three ride options (60, 75, and 100 miles). The 100-mile route takes riders from the bike shop to the Logan Martin Dam and back. The terrain is rolling with several challenging climbs.

title: Ride for More
description: This is a ride that will benefit the Exceptional Foundation as well as Project Outreach based at Spanish Fort High School. Both of these groups work with individuals with mental and physical disabilities. These are non-profit organizations. This ride takes place in the Eastern Shore area. The ride is hilly and beautiful that is loved by riders all in our area. There is a 28 mile and a 45 mile ride that are priced at $35. There is a fun ride that is between 2-3 miles long and is $20. There will be a after race meal, well stocked rest stops and SAG provided. There will also be door prizes given at the end of the ride.
course: The course runs through the northwest section of the eastern shore. The route will be well marked and there is not much traffic on the route. The route is hilly and there are not very many flat sections. It is a ride designed for all levels of riders.
registration: Registration may be completed at active.com. Search \"Ride for More\" in Spanish Fort Alabama
directions:
Get off the Malbis Exit and head north unitl the road t\'s. Go straight to Jimmy Faulkner Drive and go north to Spanish Fort High School. Address is 1 Toro Drive 
Spanish Fort, Alabama 36527

title: Rocket City Criterium Races
description:
Ominum race weekend.  
Saturday morning TT up the Historic Bankhead Blvd finishing in Monte Sano State Park.  Saturday Alabama Criterium Championships will be held downtown Huntsville at Big Spring Park.  ERC sponsored Kids Rocket Races will be held on the criterium course.  The SAIC Adaptive Cycling Challenge are scheduled for both days.  
Sunday\'s Bicycle Cove Circuit Races will be held at Research Park, North of Redstone Arsenal.
course:
The Omnium consist of the following three races:
The Saturday morning TT starts with a 1.3 mile 5% avg. up hill section and finishes at 1.8 miles atop Monte Sano Mtn. 
The Satureday criterium course is a .7 mile loop that has two gradual rises with a fun sweeping left turn to a fast downhill finish.
The Sunday circuit races are held on a 3.1 closed course through Reseach Office Park.  The glass-like roads have been resurfaced this year.
registration: Online registration is available at usacycling.org and mail-in forms are available online and can be mailed to:  P.O. Box 2231, Huntsville AL. 35804.
notes:
Friday night packet pick-up and on-site registration will be held at the downtown Holiday Inn at 401 Williams Avenue Southwest, Huntsville, AL 35801, facing Big Spring Park.
Omnium registrations must be completed by the on-line deadline of Wednesday, May 16
directions:
From I65, take 565 into Huntsville.  
From Hiway 72, travel west to Huntsville (Exit 19A)
Saturday Races:
For TT, Take 565 Exit 19C to Washington St and a quick right turn onto Pratt Ave.  Follow Pratt up the hill, name changes to Bankhead Pkwy, and turn left on Nolen to enter Monte Sano State Park. Parking is available only on top in the Park.
For Citerium race, Take 565 Exit 19C to Jefferson St towards downtown. Turn right on Monroe and left on Church St to the Big Spring Park start/finish area.  Parking is available at office lots along Williams and Gallitan Sts.
Sunday Races:
Take 565 to Research Park exit, 255 north, Exit 13 or 14B from downtown.  Immediately take the Old Madison Pike exit and turn right/west to cross 255.  Take third right on Jan Davis Dr to Explorer Blvd.  Parking area is at Qinetiq, 890 Explorer Blvd NW, Huntsville, AL 35806.

title: BUMP & GRIND
description:
Seventeenth Annual Bump N\' Grind at Oak Mountain State Park presented by the Birmingham Urban Mountain Pedalers.
Short Track, SuperD and Downhill - June 2
Cross Country Race - June 3
directions:
Oak Mountain is just south of Birmingham off I-65 and Hwy. 119. The exit off I-65 is four miles south of the I-65/I-459 interchange. It is exit #246 and is listed as Cahaba Valley Road (also Hwy. 119). This is also the street where most of the hotels are and Cahaba Cycles is 1/2 mile west of I-65 at the intersection of Hwy. 119 with US-31.
 
Go west on 119 and take a left at the first light on the west side of I-65 onto State Park Road. There’s a BP station at the intersection. Go two miles and at the stop sign you’ll take a left to the entrance to Oak Mtn. State Park. Weekend admission is $3.00 per adult. Follow the signs within the park to South Trailhead Parking Lot. The map below marks some of our sponsors’ locations, lodging options and points of interest.

title: SCRD Rocket City Omnium
course:
RR = 10.5 Mile Loop of flat to rolling terrain
TT = 0.6 Mile Point to Point non-technical climb
Crit = 0.7 Mile Loop with 6 corners and uphill finish
notes:
$11,000 in CASH Prizes
$2200 in CASH for Women
Deep Payouts in all Categories
Deep Omnium Payout
Additional Crit Entries only $15
directions: Please refer to the 2012 SCRD Summer Omnium Race Bible for directions and other important information.

title: Herron Dermatology Southeastern TT Championship
description: The 2012 Southeastern Time Trial Championship will be held in Montgomery, AL on August 4th.
course:
40k  Adult TT Course, Smooth, Flat, Fast.
12k Junior TT Course, even smoother, flatter and faster...
http://www.mapmyride.com/routes/view/69572182/
directions:
Take Exit 9 \"Taylor Road\" from I-85. Drive South on Taylor Road (also known as AL-271) toward US-231. Continue past Eastchase Shopping Center and the Vaughn Road Intersection. Drive 1.5 miles past Vaughn Road on Taylor. The main entrance to Hampstead will appear on the Left side of Taylor Road. Turn into Hampstead between the Town Center Buildings


Turn onto Taylor Road (also known as AL-271) at the major intersection, traveling South toward US-231. Drive 1.5 miles from Vaughn Road on Taylor. The main entrance to Hampstead will appear on the Left side of Taylor Road. Turn into Hampstead between the Town Center Buildings


Turn Right onto Taylor Road (also known as AL-271) traveling toward Interstate 85. The main entrance to Hampstead will appear on the Right side of Taylor Road. Turn into Hampstead between the Town Center Buildings

REMEMBER THE TEAM TENT POINTS!!!

title: Tour of Alabama 2012
description:
The Tour of Alabama for 2012 is our inaugural road cycling event to ride across Alabama in 5 days and in nearly 400 miles. This is more than a tour, it’s a personal challenge that will help push you further! 

Participants must arrange for transportation to and from the event starting (Florence, AL) and ending points (Auburn, AL). Participants must arrange for their own lodging at each overnight location. 

Aid stations will be provided along the route.
course: 5 days, 400 miles and 19,000 feet of climbing! This year we’ll start from Florence and ride to Huntsville on the first day.  The second day will start in Huntsville and end at Lake Guntserville.  The third day will start at Lake Guntersville and end in the town of Centre.  The fourth day starts in Centre and will finish at Mt. Cheaha State Park.  The final day starts at Mt. Cheaha and finishes in Auburn. There are several climbs throughout the ride with the most challenging being Mt. Cheaha with over 12 miles of grades from 1-10%.
directions: The ride will start Monday, October 8, 2012 at 8am from Point Park in Florence, Alabama. See this link for the exact location: https://maps.google.com/maps?q=point+park,+florence,+alabama&ll=34.810826,-87.626867&spn=0.012315,0.026157&fb=1&gl=us&hq=point+park,+florence,+alabama&hnear=point+park,+florence,+alabama&cid=0,0,455713620010755283&t=m&z=16&iwloc=A

directions: I 65 exit 310 onto hwy 157 east. Turn south on hwy 31 approx. 1 mile Park is on right at 1544 Sportsman Lake Rd.

title: Anniston CX Double Down
description: The 2012 Anniston CX DoubleDown p/b Wig\'s Wheels has expanded to two days of racing. The DoubleDown will be stops 7 and 8 on the BamaCross CX Series. Please come and join us for Alabama\'s only NIGHT RACE and stay over to race again the following day.
course: The course will consist of grass, gravel, pavement, and of course the famous \"Woodland Park Sand Pit\".
registration: Race registration online will be available thru 11/15/2012 on usacycling.org. After online registration closes registration will be available starting at 2pm on 11/17/2012 at the Woodland Park Softball Complex. Sunday race registration will open at 8am.
notes: Please remeber that NO Glass Bottles are allowed INSIDE the Softball Complex!
directions: The 2012 Anniston CX DoubleDown p/b Wig\'s Wheels will take place at The City of Anniston\'s Woodland Park Softball Complex. The complex is located at 901 Glade Road Anniston, AL 36206.

title: Bamacross #10
description: This is the final race of the Bamacross Series for 2012.
registration:
Pre-registration will be on BikeReg, and the cost is $25, with juniors only being $10.  On-site registration will be $30.  On-site registration will open at 9 AM and close 15 minutes prior to each schedule race start.  Racers may participate on a USA Cycling one-day license, but if you are Cat 3 and higher, then you must possess a USA Cycling annual license.  You will need to have this license, or authorization to ride form, to be able to register.

The entry fee for a second event will be $10 if you are eligible.
notes:
Warm-up will be permitted on the course between races at the officials discretion.  The races will be held rain, or shine.  Helmets must be worn at all times while riding.  Racing on a mountain bike is permitted, but the bike cannot be equipped with bar ends.  The race director reserves the right to combine categories and/or prizes due to attendance.  Any category with fewer than 5 participants will be combined.  

If you have any further questions, then you can contact the race director at the following email address: marshallbrent@gmail.com
